text.*:
The Wings of Icarus

Chapter Info

Volume:

110

Chapter:

1114

Japanese Title:

イカロスの翼

Romanized Title:

Ikarosu no Tsubasa

Viz Title:

The Wings of Icarus

Pages:

15

Release Date:

May 13, 2024

WSJ Issue:

2024 Issue 24
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1114 is titled "The Wings of Icarus".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage Vol. 4 "Go enshrine this sword at Hakumai's Enma Shrine in Yasuie's stead. That is your surrogate pilgrimage!"

Short Summary[]

Various people around the world are shocked by Dr. Vegapunk's message, to which at Impel Down Doflamingo believes that most cities will sink once the sea rises five more meters. The Five Elders decide to destroy any life form to stop the transmission. As Saturn reaches the Power Plant where the Mother Flame is stored, Vegapunk confirms that this problem is not natural and is his first sin. He then reveals his second sin was researching the Void Century and tells the world about Joy Boy who was the very first pirate, as Edison finishes his plan for the Thousand Sunny to leave Egghead.

Long Summary[]

The Marines are shocked by Dr. Vegapunk’s claim that the world will sink into the Blue Sea, but there are others across the world who do not believe him, like the people in Mock Town on Jaya. The people of Water 7 are skeptical that a few rising tides signifies that the entire world is bound to sink. In Impel Down, meanwhile, Doflamingo is laughing at Dr. Vegapunk’s claims and he mockingly asks Magellan what he will do when the prison gets completely flooded, since it is his job to protect the inmates. Magellan admits the rising tides have caused havoc in the cells, and that was only just one meter. Doflamingo says that most urban areas would be in danger if the sea level rose another five meters, and perhaps they should all evacuate to somewhere “higher up.”

Down in Ryugu Kingdom, Shirahoshi asks her father if the scientist’s words are true, but Neptune says it sounds too outlandish. As for the Marines outside of Egghead, several Marines fear that Dr. Vegapunk’s words will incite mass panic and chaos, regardless if it is true. The Five Elders and York, meanwhile, have become desperate and decide to just annihilate every living thing on the island.

In the broadcast, Dr. Vegapunk says that according to his sensor data, he predicts a few days from now as he records this message, there will be a massive earthquake, which several people, such as Charlotte Smoothie, figure is the earthquake they just felt today. Dr. Vegapunk continues saying that following this earthquake, the sea level around the world will rise by one meter, which will render a number of islands uninhabitable, and submerge several beaches. He says that if this does not happen then everyone can ignore his next words, but if it does, he implores everyone to listen to him. The people are left speechless by Dr. Vegapunk’s prediction as he claims it was not a natural phenomenon.

As he continues to speak, Saturn furiously continues his attack on the Straw Hat Pirates demanding Dr. Vegapunk stop. Ultimately, Saturn decides to ignore the crew and head straight for the power station containing the Mother Flame, which is revealed to be a small flame within a large tank. Once there, Saturn changes back to his human form and starts smashing things with his staff. As he does so, Dr. Vegapunk tells the world that his first sin was due to him naively desiring to bring peace and prosperity to the world, and in his search to bring the world to a bigger and brighter future, he fears he flew too close to the sun.

The Marines continue to attack the Iron Giant, but nothing affects it. Dorry, Brogy, and Luffy, who transformed into his Gear Fifth form once again, continue to flee, but the fire has spread across the island and Warcury is still charging after them. Dr. Vegapunk continues saying in order to explain this sin he committed, he needs to explain what happened between 900 and 800 years ago, i.e. the Void Century. Imu and the World Nobles watch, with the latter demanding the Marines silence Dr. Vegapunk, while some become curious about his words. Dr. Vegapunk says that while most of that period’s history is erased, the Poneglyphs hold the key to understanding the truth. Elsewhere, Jaguar D. Saul, who is relaxing somewhere, starts laughing.

Dr. Vegapunk says that the World Government outlawed deciphering the Poneglyphs, but he himself researched them, which is the second grave sin he committed. Thanks to the documents left behind by the people of Ohara, he was able to decipher a number of the stones, and he does not regret one bit of it. As for the Straw Hat crew, the clouds start stretching, and they realize that Edison has increased the edge of the clouds to allow the Thousand Sunny to leap right into the ocean. Edison, meanwhile, prays that the Straw Hats not let the Marines catch them after everything. Luffy, meanwhile, is still trying to fight Warcury despite Brogy telling him to stop because nothing he does affects him. Luffy confidently believes his next attack will hurt him, but when he punches Warcury again, he recoils in pain.

Dr. Vegapunk says that he only knows a little bit of what happened in the Void Century, so he will just tell everyone what he knows. What he learned was that during that period of time, there was a man who was born in a highly advanced kingdom, and he possessed a rubbery body akin to the Sun God Nika, who was worshiped by the Giants. This man’s name was Joy Boy, and he was the first man to set out at sea; the world’s first pirate.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • People around the world react to Vegapunk's claim about it sinking into the sea.
    • According to Donquixote Doflamingo, most of the world's towns would be engulfed by the sea if its levels increased by another 5 meters.
    • Vegapunk correctly predicted in advance the global earthquake and its consequences that would happen during the present day, claiming that it is not a natural phenomenon.
  • The Five Elders decide to destroy any lifeform they find in order to interrupt the broadcast.
    • Jaygarcia Saturn fights his way past Nami's group, reaches the Mother Flame-producing room and starts eliminating the Den Den Mushi inside.
  • Certain World Nobles like Shalria appeared to be unaware of what the Void Century is.
  • The Marines attack the Iron Giant, but to no avail.
  • Edison manages to activate a device that stretches the Labophase's clouds, as well as the Thousand Sunny's location, towards Egghead's shores.
  • Vegapunk reveals who Joy Boy was and his role in the Void Century, based on Ohara's research on the subject.
    • According to Vegapunk, Joy Boy was the first ever pirate, as well as an inhabitant of the Great Kingdom who had the power of stretching.
    • Nika is revealed to be the sun god of Elbaph.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


Two of my editors as well as one of my former editors got married. Happy stories are the best. Congratulations!


担当が2人、完担当が1人籍婚ラッシュ!!めでたい話は良いものです。おめでとう!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.
